body:
Comment 3: 
If this were going to work, it would work by using Make.cmd,
which is for building Go programs.  Make.ccmd is for the C-only
tools like the compiler.

However, Make.cmd does not know all the cgo magic that
Make.pkg does, so right now you have to split your
command into two packages.  This will get better when
we retire the makefiles in favor of the still-under-development
'go' tool.  Then you'll be able to just import "C" in your
package main and it will work, no questions asked.
_Status changed to **Unfortunate**._
